name: trespass
content:
trespass verb [I]
(BREAK LAW)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to go onto someone's land or enter their building without permission: I hope this is a public footpath and we're not trespassing on someone's land.

old use to do something or act in a way that is not morally acceptable

(NOT MORAL)

to enter someone’s property without permission: I didn’t realize I was trespassing on their land. trespasser noun [ C ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈtresˌpæs·ər, -pə·sər/
They have several dogs to keep trespassers out.
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of going onto land or entering a building without the owner's permission: If you enter oil refinery land, you can be arrested for trespass.
to go onto land or enter a building without the owner’s permission: trespassing charges/laws A landlord cannot normally claim that a tenant is trespassing on his property. Phrasal verb
trespass on sth
